item.title: Rule 1 - Social Media Marketing - don't leave it to PR or the intern
item.description: Social Media marketing - using Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Foursquare, Google+ - needs to form part of any marketing plan across the marketing mix.

item.title: 41 things to do in 41 days to boost your digital marketing
item.description: [typography font=”Special Elite” size=”25″ size_format=”px”]Want a quick head start to a digital marketing plan for your brand or business?

item.title: 3 articles to read on Brand Marketing - Strategy
item.description: You’ll love these 3 articles by Mark Ritson who has a weekly opinion piece in Marketing Week.

item.title: Axure - workflow for business process - web applications
item.description: It’s pretty easy to jump in the deep end with Axure and start building wireframes and hi-fi clickable prototypes.

item.title: Required Summer Reading for startups - product development
item.description: No one usually likes to rave about their best kept secrets - in this case essential reading material for any entreprenuer, startup or marketing manager.

item.title: Starting in Digital? Don't ruin your brand reputation with your 1st social media marketing campaign
item.description: Digital marketing has its benefits mainly that it’s easy to launch a social media campaign without any prior relationship with the victim.

item.title: Management lessons we can learn from films - TRON
item.description: TRON is still a superb film, I was too young when it was first issued, but watching it recently started me thinking about business strategy and business models for startups.

item.title: Are you on top of your Social Media Marketing Strategy for 2011?
item.description: You’re never too late to start your 2011 Social Media Marketing Strategy - This year has gone so fast and I missed starting my Marketing Strategy on 1/1/11.

item.title: Apple Mac App Store an imperfect tool for small apps developers?
item.description: Apple’s new Mac App Store arrives on January 6 and it could be the perfect tool for small app developers and a welcome boost in hybrid web-app startups.
